title: Chinese President Urges Restraint on North Korea in Call With Trump
content:
BEIJING—In a phone call with President Donald Trump , Chinese President Xi Jinping urged restraint in dealing with North Korea , hours after the American leader said military resources were in place , “ locked and loaded , ” should Pyongyang “ act unwisely . ”
Both sides emphasized different takeaways from the call , which was expected to occur .
According to a statement issued by the White House early Saturday , “ the leaders affirmed that the recent adoption of a new United Nations Security Council resolution on North Korea was an important and necessary step toward achieving peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula . ”
“ President Trump and President Xi agreed North Korea must stop its provocative and escalatory behavior , ” the White House statement said .
According to an account of the call published by state broadcaster China Central Television , Mr. Xi said all sides should “ avoid words and deeds that increase tensions on the Korean Peninsula . ”
Mr. Xi told Mr. Trump that dialogue remains the best way to resolve the North Korean nuclear problem , and that China is willing to work with the U.S. to push for an “ appropriate solution , ” according to CCTV .
Mr. Trump told Mr. Xi that he “ completely understands the role China has played in dealing with the North Korean nuclear problem , ” according to the CCTV account . Mr. Trump also said relations between the U.S. and China are developing in a positive direction , the broadcaster said .
Foreign leaders from around the world have called on Washington and Pyongyang to end a cycle of rhetorical threats that have raised the specter of nuclear war .
French President Emmanuel Macron spoke by phone Saturday with Mr. Trump about the crisis in North Korea , “ with the objective of avoiding all escalation , ” an official from Mr. Macron ’ s office said Saturday , adding that the two leaders agreed to stay in touch in coming days .
Earlier Saturday , the French president ’ s office issued a statement decrying a “ dangerous escalation ” on the part of the regime in Pyongyang and calling on the international community to “ ensure that North Korea returns without conditions to the path of dialogue . ”
The White House later issued a statement saying Messrs. Trump and Macron “ pledged to work together with allies and partners to enforce United Nations sanctions and achieve denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula. ” It noted that the U.S “ is ready , along with its allies , to apply the full range of diplomatic , economic , and military measures to achieve that goal . ”

“President Trump and President Xi agreed North Korea must stop its provocative and escalatory behavior,” the White House statement said.

According to an account of the call published by state broadcaster China Central Television, Mr. Xi said all sides should “avoid words and deeds that increase tensions on the Korean Peninsula.”

Mr. Xi told Mr. Trump that dialogue remains the best way to resolve the North Korean nuclear problem, and that China is willing to work with the U.S. to push for an “appropriate solution,” according to CCTV.

Mr. Trump told Mr. Xi that he “completely understands the role China has played in dealing with the North Korean nuclear problem,” according to the CCTV account. Mr. Trump also said relations between the U.S. and China are developing in a positive direction, the broadcaster said.

Foreign leaders from around the world have called on Washington and Pyongyang to end a cycle of rhetorical threats that have raised the specter of nuclear war.

French President Emmanuel Macron spoke by phone Saturday with Mr. Trump about the crisis in North Korea, “with the objective of avoiding all escalation,” an official from Mr. Macron’s office said Saturday, adding that the two leaders agreed to stay in touch in coming days.

Earlier Saturday, the French president’s office issued a statement decrying a “dangerous escalation” on the part of the regime in Pyongyang and calling on the international community to “ensure that North Korea returns without conditions to the path of dialogue.”

The White House later issued a statement saying Messrs. Trump and Macron “pledged to work together with allies and partners to enforce United Nations sanctions and achieve denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.” It noted that the U.S “is ready, along with its allies, to apply the full range of diplomatic, economic, and military measures to achieve that goal.”
